creator: jp49c5mbs7

content:
This area is called the message list pane. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova

> There does not appear to be an option to rid these two items from the inbox in the second instance.

There is not. These items are needed to expand and collapse message threads.
creator: wsmwk

content: Set View/Sort by to Unthreaded. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with View is hidden.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thanks sfhowes for the tip. I was able to delete the thread > icon. However, I still would like to eliminate the arrows. To be honest, I do not even know what they are used for, or their meaning.

There must be a way to do this as I am running TB 115.8.0 on both my Macs and as my screen shots show one of them does not have those icons and one does. I have checked and rechecked all my settings and they appear to be the same on both Macs.

How about css chrome or config?
creator: jp49c5mbs7

content: The ONLY way they legitimately go away is what sfhowes stated.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne Mery, I agree that sfhowes tip did get rid of the > icon, but he did not address the issue with the little arrows, which I still do not understand what their purpose is.

Not withstanding the above, I still cannot reconcile that fact that, as shown in my screen shots, the 2 Macs each running TB 115.8.0, display the message pane differently. One has the arrows and the other does not. That is proof to me that their must be a setting that eliminates/adds the arrows, otherwise how do we explain that they are present on one Mac and not the other?
creator: jp49c5mbs7

content: If you means the coloured arrows to the left of the Subject, they indicate the message has been replied to (points to left) or forwarded (points to right). It is possible to modify them with css, or to hide them entirely, but most users keep them once they know their significance.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you sfhowes!! The css approach worked perfectly. I appreciate all the help.
creator: jp49c5mbs7

content:
Chiedo scusa, non ho spiegato correttamente il problema.

In Thunderbird (115.8.0 a 64 bit) Il corpo email i è questo:

Ciao Andrea N 4 panelli tetto 80 bg L 4000 €/mq 27 più sfrido N 100 fissaggi L 6.3x170 ferro €/cad 0,60 N 100 cappellotti bg €/cad 0,25 N 100 rondelle pvc &/cad 0,07 Trasporto 50€

Prima di eseguire l'inoltro in Thnderbird il messaggio viene riformattato in modo casuale:

Ciao Andrea N 4 panelli tetto 80 bg L 4000 €/mq 27 più sfrido N 100 fissaggi L 6.3x170 ferro €/cad 0,60 N 100 cappellotti bg €/cad 0,25 N 100 rondelle pvc &/cad 0,07 Trasporto 50€

E' possibile risolvere questo problema ?
creator: infotek.michele

content: Se io copio il tuo esempio sopra in una nuova email, resta tutto intatto e non avviene nessuna riformattazione. Presumo che il realtà tu stia usando il formato HTML. E bisognerebbe analizzare il codice per capire cosa succede. Intanto potresti aggiungere due screenshot del testo come lo formatti tu e come viene alterato. E un altro screen con il sorgente del messaggio (Ctrl+u).

content: Hi David, Using imap.ionos.com and smtp.ionos.com as hosting for my emails and websites. All with Windows 10 and prior to 115.8 I must have been using all versions going back 20 years. I opted for auto renewal of updates years ago. I have not clue why I was asked for my Thunderbird password which I could not find. I went online and lots of others were not happy with 115.8 and spoke about 102.15.1. I installed 102.15.1 with a new password. Yesterday after a few days of trying to retrieve my calendar with birthdays, anniversary's and whatever it installed. Very happy. Prior to going back to 102.15.1 U did a backup of my Thunderbird folder and my guess is i have a new folder with 102.15.1 I would up grade to 116. On my Windows 10 I have two options. One to log into my Ionos.com email hosting account or 102.15.1 Thunderbird account which does not show all those many emails in my Ionos.com Thunderbird account. I also have an S23 cell phone with K9 mail account and it shows all those many emails I see in my Ionos.com laptop account. Very strange S23 and Ionos show all emails and Windows 10 does not. It was suggested my Best Buy I wait until Thunderbird 116 issues. I reset my Thunderbird option to opt out of automatic new updates. With your help I might reconsider downloading Thunderbird 116 to solve what problem I have with viewing all those emails showing in my Ionos and K9 folders. Oh, and whatever version I had prior to 115.8 I liked it more than 102.15.1 Thanks and hope you can help.

content:
You could start is offering facts about the process.

The vast majority of folk having issues sending and receiving "some" mail are those with custom / personal domains that are simply not configured correctly for the ever more stringent delivery requirement of providers like google.

Others are relying on the skills of some of the USA finest internet service providers that have been making a mess of email for as long as I have used email. Yet other folk have fancy email signatures that include images their recipient has identified as Spam related (usually downloaded blue Fs and little stylized Ts

Others include tracking information in their email which send the receivers privacy tools spare and they drop the email.

Really your question as stated is like the perennial "how long in a piece of string?"

content:
The incoming and outgoing gmail servers should use OAuth2 authentication. The outgoing mycci.net port should be 465 with SSL/TLS security.

https://www.consolidated.com/support/email-settings-user-guides/ht-email-user-guides/email-server-settings

Set each account to send on an smtp server with matching User Name (email address).

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes

content: TB 115 supports CardDAV without add-ons: in Address Book, click New Address Book, Add CardDAV Address Book, enter your gmail address, complete the OAuth authentication with the account password, add Google Contacts as a new address book.
creator: sfhowes
